About Me

Hello my name is Caitanya (J-tan-ya), but everyone calls me Jay for short. I am a computer science graduate from the University of Kent, whilst studying I found I had a knack for web development. Once I finished my degree I decided I wanted to pursue a career in web development, my goal is to eventually become a full stack developer. Every day I am pushing myself to learn something new that can help me with this goal, so far this is where I am.

Bio

I am 23 years old and I live in Canterbury originally from Tenterden. Growing up, like many others I had an interest in technology, keeping up to date with it and interacting with it where I could. Eventually when I got the chance I built myself my own computer, I quickly became adept at troubleshooting issues with Google. My interest in tech led me to pursue a career in computer science; as I was not sure what I specifically wanted to do. Whilst at university I found that web assignments interested me more and as such I had an easier time completing them, that was when I decided to pursue a career in web development.

Languages I know

HTML

All the websites I have built of course use HTML. Some projects more than others, for example in my fullstack project I mainly used Ruby to build HTML. With each new project my usage of HTML is improving.

CSS

Most of my projects in the past (not hosted) I built using raw CSS as I learnt the fundementals. More recently I have built projects using the fron-end framework Bootstrap and for this portfolio website I have used node-sass. Node-sass has been a particular delight to work with and learn all the cool tricks that CSS can not do.

JavaScript

I have a strong foundation of object orientated programming principles from my time at university. What I have learnt at university I have found a lot of cross over into JavaScript; despite varying syntax. Additionally I was taught raw JavaScript at university, since then I have made use of the jQuery library and node npm for this website.

PHP

I have been taught PHP at university, but have put more time into my front end skills to eventually make use of what I have built using back end skills. Most notably at university I built a php script which paganated an SQL database. I am currently learning Laravel to improve my PHP and back end skills.

SQL

Once again the bulk of my learning for SQL was done at university, I had modules combining web and databases as well as strict database only ones. I am proficient in database creation, querying and editing on relational data. In a more recent project I have used SQL in conjunction with Ruby on Rails.

Ruby

Ruby is a newer venture, my fullstack project was built on Amazon Web Services using Ruby on Rails. Using a MVC framework such as rails allowed me to quickly build out an application with many features using gems. It was a difficult experience at points as the workflow using MVC is quite different.
